thread.title: Rescue operation under way after ferry runs aground off Isle of Wight with 'cries of people heard from the water'

author: Sophie Barley
title: Rescue operation under way after ferry runs aground off Isle of Wight with 'cries of people heard from the water'
text:
News Ferry runs aground off Isle of Wight after 'colliding with yachts' with 'cries of people heard from the water' Lifeboats have been launched as a passenger ferry is reportedly in trouble off the coast of the Isle of Wight Share Red Falcon Ferry that reportedly collided with at least two yachts while trying to berth at the entrance of Cowes Harbour during heavy fog (Image: @thetony_howard) Get daily updates directly to your inbox Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
A search operation is underway after a ferry 'collided with at least two yachts' while 'running aground in heavy fog' at East Cowes on the Isle of Wight.
A Red Funnel ferry was reported to be out of position around 40-50m from shore at East Cowes.
The Maritime and Coastguard Agency said a member of the public called 999 reporting cries of help from the water
A search and rescue helicopter was launched but had to turn back due to low visibility, the Mirror reports.
The Island Echo reported rescue teams were searching for people in the water earlier this morning. A Red Funnel ferry (Image: Getty Images)
Its Editor Darren Toogood, who was at the scene, told MirrorOnline that the ferry had run aground - and that he could see a mast sticking out of the water where a small vessel has sunk after a 'collision'.
He said: "People have heard cries for help, witnesses. There's a search to rule out people in the water. Initial information was that the boat was tied up so they want to rule out there are people there."
"The ferry's aground completely. It's so close I can get the ferry's wifi. It's high tide now so it won't move for another 12 hours." Read More Fake phone charger bursts into flames and MELTS part of floor in Northumberland home
Cowes RNLI Lifeboat, Ventnor Coastguard Rescue Team and Bembridge Coastguard Rescue Team were launched.
A spokesperson for the coastguard said: "Just after 8am today HM Coastguard received reports that the Red Falcon Ferry had collided with at least two yachts whilst trying to berth at the entrance of Cowes Harbour during heavy fog. Read More Nigel Farage talks Brexit and Theresa May before downing 'strongest pint in Wetherspoons'
"At around the same time we received a 999 call from a member of the public reporting that he'd heard cries for help within Cowes Harbour.
"We are currently carrying at an extensive search of the area with Cowes RNLI lifeboat, Calshot RNLI lifeboats and Coastguard Rescue Teams from Bembridge, Needles and Ventnor.
"A Coastguard search and rescue helicopter was searching the area but due to the low visibility in the area had to turn back. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
"The search is ongoing and we have no further information at this stage.
"The ferry with 56 persons onboard remains grounded at the entrance at Cowes.
"Those persons onboard are safe and well." Like us on Facebook
